channel.title: Research Projects on Eugenia San Segundo
channel.description: Recent content in Research Projects on Eugenia San Segundo

item.title: Research on Key Technologies for Forensic Speaker Comparison
item.description: International project at the Shanxi Police College (Taiyuan, China)

item.title: Perceptual, spectral and prosodic correlates of vocal tract tension
item.description: SNSF project aimed at testing whether perceptual ratings for vocal tract tension correlate with prosodic-acoustic measures.

item.title: How to deal with voice quality in Forensic Phonetics
item.description: IAFPA project aimed at providing a simplified, yet reliable and validated, perceptual protocol that could be used by forensic phoneticians to describe a speaker in terms of his/her voice quality, and/or when required to compare two or more voices using an auditory approach.

item.title: Voice and Identity: Source, Filter, Biometric
Forensic comparison of Spanish twins and non-twin brothers
item.description: IAFPA project aimed at investigating the usefulness of analyzing speech samples of adult male Spanish siblings and twins (identical and fraternal), with a focus on analyzing formant trajectories in vocalic sequences.

item.title: Incorporation of forensic analysis techniques as part of an automatic speaker recognition system
item.description: University of New South Wales project funded by the Intelligence Advanced Research Projects Activity (IARPA), through the Army Research Laboratory (ARL)

item.title: Cualidad Individual de la Voz en la Identificaci√≥n de Locutor
item.description: Project funded by the Spanish Ministry of Science and Innovation
